definition: to comfort oneself/to console oneself/to reassure oneself
content/calm/still/quiet/safe/secure/in good health/to find a place for/to install/to fix/to fit/to bring (a charge against sb)/to pacify/to harbor (good intentions)/security/safety/peace/ampere

sentences.english: "We hardly get sick at all, " Mrs McKamey says hopefully.
sentences.chinese: “我们根本不怎么得病，”麦克康美太太自我安慰说。

sentences.english: The Italians are without even that comfort.
sentences.chinese: 但是意大利却连这样的自我安慰都没有。

sentences.english: Sometimes he consoled himself by that.
sentences.chinese: 有时候他这样自我安慰着。

sentences.english: Don’t let the powers of rationalization take you further, though.
sentences.chinese: 不要让那种自我安慰的力量影响你。

sentences.english: Verily, he is not indignant at their modes of consolation and ingratitude.
sentences.chinese: 其实，他并不气恼他们自我安慰和忘恩负义的模式。

sentences.english: You haven't let the powerful forces of rationalization prevent you from committing to self-change.
sentences.chinese: 你没有让那种自我安慰的力量赴阻止你改变我自己。

sentences.english: That, at least, is what we tell ourselves. But what we tell ourselves is hooey.
sentences.chinese: 这至少是我们的自我安慰，但我们错了。

sentences.english: There is a love called to let go, to be but only comfort myself an excuse.
sentences.chinese: 有一种爱叫做放手，只不外是自我安慰的借口。

sentences.english: You haven’t let the powerful forces of rationalization prevent you from committing to self-change.
sentences.chinese: 你没有让那种自我安慰的力量去阻止你改变自己。

definition: to deceive others and to deceive oneself/to believe one's own lies
to be full of remorse/to repent and redress one's errors
to mock oneself/to laugh at oneself
to refer to one's foibles or failings with self-deprecating humor
a modal particle indicating (that's all, only, nothing much)
a modal particle indicating (don't mind it, ok)
to accept misfortunes as decreed by fate/to be resigned to sth
lit. silly people get their panties in a bunch (idiom)/fig. to get upset over nothing/to make problems for oneself
(idiom) to blame the gods and accuse others
